parameters.name: meshName
parameters.description: The name of the service mesh that the virtual node resides in.

parameters.name: virtualNodeName
parameters.description: The name of the virtual node to describe.

nested_items.name: virtualNode
nested_items.description: The full description of your virtual node.

nested_items.name: meshName
nested_items.description: The name of the service mesh that the virtual node resides in.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the resource.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The Unix epoch timestamp in seconds for when the resource was created.

nested_items.name: lastUpdatedAt
nested_items.description: The Unix epoch timestamp in seconds for when the resource was last updated.

nested_items.name: meshOwner
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

nested_items.name: resourceOwner
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services IAM account ID of the resource owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the mesh owner or of another account that the mesh is shared with. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

nested_items.name: uid
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the resource.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: The version of the resource. Resources are created at version 1, and this version is incremented each time that they're updated.

nested_items.name: backendDefaults
nested_items.description: A reference to an object that represents the defaults for backends.

nested_items.name: clientPolicy
nested_items.description: A reference to an object that represents a client policy.

nested_items.name: certificate
nested_items.description: A reference to an object that represents a client's TLS certificate.

nested_items.name: certificateChain
nested_items.description: The certificate chain for the certificate.

nested_items.name: privateKey
nested_items.description: The private key for a certificate stored on the file system of the virtual node that the proxy is running on.

nested_items.name: secretName
nested_items.description: A reference to an object that represents the name of the secret requested from the Secret Discovery Service provider representing Transport Layer Security (TLS) materials like a certificate or certificate chain.

nested_items.name: enforce
nested_items.description: Whether the policy is enforced. The default is True, if a value isn't specified.

nested_items.name: ports
nested_items.description: One or more ports that the policy is enforced for.
(integer) ---

nested_items.name: validation
nested_items.description: A reference to an object that represents a TLS validation context.

nested_items.name: subjectAlternativeNames
nested_items.description: A reference to an object that represents the SANs for a Transport Layer Security (TLS) validation context. If you don't specify SANs on the terminating mesh endpoint, the Envoy proxy for that node doesn't verify the SAN on a peer client certificate. If you don't specify SANs on the originating mesh endpoint, the SAN on the certificate provided by the terminating endpoint must match the mesh endpoint service discovery configuration. Since SPIRE vended certificates have a SPIFFE ID as a name, you must set the SAN since the name doesn't match the service discovery name.

nested_items.name: exact
nested_items.description: The values sent must match the specified values exactly.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: certificateAuthorityArns
nested_items.description: One or more ACM Amazon Resource Name (ARN)s.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: certificateChain
nested_items.description: The certificate trust chain for a certificate stored on the file system of the virtual node that the proxy is running on.

nested_items.name: secretName
nested_items.description: A reference to an object that represents the name of the secret for a Transport Layer Security (TLS) Secret Discovery Service validation context trust.

nested_items.name: backends
nested_items.description: The backends that the virtual node is expected to send outbound traffic to.

nested_items.name: virtualService
nested_items.description: Specifies a virtual service to use as a backend.

nested_items.name: clientPolicy
nested_items.description: A reference to an object that represents the client policy for a backend.

nested_items.name: certificate
nested_items.description: A reference to an object that represents a client's TLS certificate.

nested_items.name: certificateChain
nested_items.description: The certificate chain for the certificate.

nested_items.name: privateKey
nested_items.description: The private key for a certificate stored on the file system of the virtual node that the proxy is running on.

nested_items.name: secretName
nested_items.description: A reference to an object that represents the name of the secret requested from the Secret Discovery Service provider representing Transport Layer Security (TLS) materials like a certificate or certificate chain.

nested_items.name: enforce
nested_items.description: Whether the policy is enforced. The default is True, if a value isn't specified.

nested_items.name: ports
nested_items.description: One or more ports that the policy is enforced for.
(integer) ---

nested_items.name: validation
nested_items.description: A reference to an object that represents a TLS validation context.

nested_items.name: subjectAlternativeNames
nested_items.description: A reference to an object that represents the SANs for a Transport Layer Security (TLS) validation context. If you don't specify SANs on the terminating mesh endpoint, the Envoy proxy for that node doesn't verify the SAN on a peer client certificate. If you don't specify SANs on the originating mesh endpoint, the SAN on the certificate provided by the terminating endpoint must match the mesh endpoint service discovery configuration. Since SPIRE vended certificates have a SPIFFE ID as a name, you must set the SAN since the name doesn't match the service discovery name.

nested_items.name: exact
nested_items.description: The values sent must match the specified values exactly.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: certificateAuthorityArns
nested_items.description: One or more ACM Amazon Resource Name (ARN)s.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: certificateChain
nested_items.description: The certificate trust chain for a certificate stored on the file system of the virtual node that the proxy is running on.

nested_items.name: secretName
nested_items.description: A reference to an object that represents the name of the secret for a Transport Layer Security (TLS) Secret Discovery Service validation context trust.

nested_items.name: virtualServiceName
nested_items.description: The name of the virtual service that is acting as a virtual node backend.

nested_items.name: listeners
nested_items.description: The listener that the virtual node is expected to receive inbound traffic from. You can specify one listener.

nested_items.name: connectionPool
nested_items.description: The connection pool information for the listener.

nested_items.name: maxRequests
nested_items.description: Maximum number of inflight requests Envoy can concurrently support across hosts in upstream cluster.

nested_items.name: maxConnections
nested_items.description: Maximum number of outbound TCP connections Envoy can establish concurrently with all hosts in upstream cluster.

nested_items.name: maxPendingRequests
nested_items.description: Number of overflowing requests after max_connections Envoy will queue to upstream cluster.

nested_items.name: maxRequests
nested_items.description: Maximum number of inflight requests Envoy can concurrently support across hosts in upstream cluster.

nested_items.name: maxConnections
nested_items.description: Maximum number of outbound TCP connections Envoy can establish concurrently with all hosts in upstream cluster.

nested_items.name: healthCheck
nested_items.description: The health check information for the listener.

nested_items.name: healthyThreshold
nested_items.description: The number of consecutive successful health checks that must occur before declaring listener healthy.

nested_items.name: intervalMillis
nested_items.description: The time period in milliseconds between each health check execution.

nested_items.name: path
nested_items.description: The destination path for the health check request. This value is only used if the specified protocol is HTTP or HTTP/2. For any other protocol, this value is ignored.

nested_items.name: port
nested_items.description: The destination port for the health check request. This port must match the port defined in the  PortMapping for the listener.

nested_items.name: protocol
nested_items.description: The protocol for the health check request. If you specify grpc, then your service must conform to the GRPC Health Checking Protocol.

nested_items.name: timeoutMillis
nested_items.description: The amount of time to wait when receiving a response from the health check, in milliseconds.

nested_items.name: unhealthyThreshold
nested_items.description: The number of consecutive failed health checks that must occur before declaring a virtual node unhealthy.

nested_items.name: outlierDetection
nested_items.description: The outlier detection information for the listener.

nested_items.name: baseEjectionDuration
nested_items.description: The base amount of time for which a host is ejected.

nested_items.name: unit
nested_items.description: A unit of time.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: A number of time units.

nested_items.name: unit
nested_items.description: A unit of time.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: A number of time units.

nested_items.name: maxEjectionPercent
nested_items.description: Maximum percentage of hosts in load balancing pool for upstream service that can be ejected. Will eject at least one host regardless of the value.

nested_items.name: maxServerErrors
nested_items.description: Number of consecutive 5xx errors required for ejection.

nested_items.name: portMapping
nested_items.description: The port mapping information for the listener.

nested_items.name: port
nested_items.description: The port used for the port mapping.

nested_items.name: protocol
nested_items.description: The protocol used for the port mapping. Specify one protocol.

nested_items.name: unit
nested_items.description: A unit of time.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: A number of time units.

nested_items.name: perRequest
nested_items.description: An object that represents a per request timeout. The default value is 15 seconds. If you set a higher timeout, then make sure that the higher value is set for each App Mesh resource in a conversation. For example, if a virtual node backend uses a virtual router provider to route to another virtual node, then the timeout should be greater than 15 seconds for the source and destination virtual node and the route.

nested_items.name: unit
nested_items.description: A unit of time.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: A number of time units.

nested_items.name: unit
nested_items.description: A unit of time.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: A number of time units.

nested_items.name: perRequest
nested_items.description: An object that represents a per request timeout. The default value is 15 seconds. If you set a higher timeout, then make sure that the higher value is set for each App Mesh resource in a conversation. For example, if a virtual node backend uses a virtual router provider to route to another virtual node, then the timeout should be greater than 15 seconds for the source and destination virtual node and the route.

nested_items.name: unit
nested_items.description: A unit of time.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: A number of time units.

nested_items.name: unit

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: A number of time units.

nested_items.name: perRequest
nested_items.description: An object that represents a per request timeout. The default value is 15 seconds. If you set a higher timeout, then make sure that the higher value is set for each App Mesh resource in a conversation. For example, if a virtual node backend uses a virtual router provider to route to another virtual node, then the timeout should be greater than 15 seconds for the source and destination virtual node and the route.

nested_items.name: unit
nested_items.description: A unit of time.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: A number of time units.

nested_items.name: unit
nested_items.description: A unit of time.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: A number of time units.

nested_items.name: certificate
nested_items.description: A reference to an object that represents a listener's Transport Layer Security (TLS) certificate.

nested_items.name: certificateArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the certificate. The certificate must meet specific requirements and you must have proxy authorization enabled. For more information, see Transport Layer Security (TLS).

nested_items.name: certificateChain
nested_items.description: The certificate chain for the certificate.

nested_items.name: privateKey
nested_items.description: The private key for a certificate stored on the file system of the virtual node that the proxy is running on.

nested_items.name: secretName
nested_items.description: A reference to an object that represents the name of the secret requested from the Secret Discovery Service provider representing Transport Layer Security (TLS) materials like a certificate or certificate chain.

nested_items.name: mode
nested_items.description: Specify one of the following modes.
STRICT --- Listener only accepts connections with TLS enabled.
PERMISSIVE --- Listener accepts connections with or without TLS enabled.
DISABLED --- Listener only accepts connections without TLS.

nested_items.name: validation
nested_items.description: A reference to an object that represents a listener's Transport Layer Security (TLS) validation context.

nested_items.name: subjectAlternativeNames
nested_items.description: A reference to an object that represents the SANs for a listener's Transport Layer Security (TLS) validation context.

nested_items.name: exact
nested_items.description: The values sent must match the specified values exactly.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: certificateChain
nested_items.description: The certificate trust chain for a certificate stored on the file system of the virtual node that the proxy is running on.

nested_items.name: secretName
nested_items.description: A reference to an object that represents the name of the secret for a Transport Layer Security (TLS) Secret Discovery Service validation context trust.

nested_items.name: accessLog
nested_items.description: The access log configuration for a virtual node.

nested_items.name: json
nested_items.description: (dict) ---

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The specified key for the JSON.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The specified value for the JSON.

nested_items.name: path
nested_items.description: The file path to write access logs to. You can use /dev/stdout to send access logs to standard out and configure your Envoy container to use a log driver, such as awslogs, to export the access logs to a log storage service such as Amazon CloudWatch Logs. You can also specify a path in the Envoy container's file system to write the files to disk.

nested_items.name: serviceDiscovery
nested_items.description: The service discovery information for the virtual node. If your virtual node does not expect ingress traffic, you can omit this parameter. If you specify a listener, then you must specify service discovery information.

nested_items.name: awsCloudMap
nested_items.description: Specifies any Cloud Map information for the virtual node.

nested_items.name: attributes
nested_items.description: A string map that contains attributes with values that you can use to filter instances by any custom attribute that you specified when you registered the instance. Only instances that match all of the specified key/value pairs will be returned.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The name of an Cloud Map service instance attribute key. Any Cloud Map service instance that contains the specified key and value is returned.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of an Cloud Map service instance attribute key. Any Cloud Map service instance that contains the specified key and value is returned.

nested_items.name: ipPreference
nested_items.description: The preferred IP version that this virtual node uses. Setting the IP preference on the virtual node only overrides the IP preference set for the mesh on this specific node.

nested_items.name: namespaceName
nested_items.description: The name of the Cloud Map namespace to use.

nested_items.name: serviceName
nested_items.description: The name of the Cloud Map service to use.

nested_items.name: hostname
nested_items.description: Specifies the DNS service discovery hostname for the virtual node.

nested_items.name: ipPreference
nested_items.description: The preferred IP version that this virtual node uses. Setting the IP preference on the virtual node only overrides the IP preference set for the mesh on this specific node.

nested_items.name: responseType
nested_items.description: Specifies the DNS response type for the virtual node.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The current status of the virtual node.

nested_items.name: virtualNodeName
nested_items.description: The name of the virtual node.
